lectures.name: Object-Oriented Programming in JavaScript
lectures.description: Classes, inheritance, encapsulation, and OOP principles - Learn to create classes, implement inheritance, handle encapsulation, and build complex object-oriented systems

questions.description: Define a class Activate and create a constructor with one property passCode containing a String representing the passCode

testCases.description: Create Activate class instance

questions.description: Write a method setPassCode, that accepts a passCode as String and saves it in the Activate then returns Passcode has been set, and if there is already a passCode return Reset passcode first

testCases.description: Set passcode for first time
Try to set passcode when one already exists

questions.description: Write a method resetPassCode that accepts argument passCode as String and meets specific requirements for resetting passcode

testCases.description: Try to reset when no passcode is set
Try to reset with wrong passcode
Reset with correct passcode

questions.description: Define a new class Lock that will inherit all features from Activate class

testCases.description: Create Lock class that extends Activate

questions.description: Within class Lock add new property isOpen and openSafe method that accepts a passcode and meets specific requirements

testCases.expected: The safe is open and ready to use
testCases.description: Open safe without passcode when no passcode is set
Try to open with wrong passcode

testCases.expected: The safe is open and ready to use
testCases.description: Open safe with correct passcode

questions.description: Write a method closeSafe that sets isOpen to false and returns The safe is closed

testCases.description: Close the safe

questions.description: Modify Lock constructor to accept an argument maxAttempts and create a method lockSafe that locks the safe after failed attempts

testCases.description: Lock safe after max attempts reached

questions.description: Modify Lock constructor to accept an argument lockDownDuration and implement time-based locking

testCases.description: Lock safe with time-based duration

questions.description: Inside the class Safe create a constructor that accepts one argument safeSize and creates a property safeSize containing the safeSize and a storage property as a array of objects

testCases.expected: Safe instance with safeSize and storage properties
testCases.description: Create Safe class with safeSize property

questions.description: Inside the class Safe create a method called insert that accepts two arguments name and size, and meets specific requirements for adding items

testCases.description: Insert item within safe size limit
Insert another item within limit
Try to insert item exceeding safe size

questions.description: Write a method remove that removes the specified item from the storage and returns the removed item and if not found return a string Not Found

testCases.description: Try to remove non-existent item
Remove existing item
Try to remove already removed item

questions.description: Modify insert and remove to only work if the safe is opened, if the safe is closed then return Please open the safe first

testCases.description: Try to insert when safe is closed
Insert when safe is open

questions.description: Create a static method guideline that will describe in clear steps how to use Safe class features

testCases.description: Get Safe class usage guidelines

questions.description: Read about private class features and try to make the passCode, and storage properties private

testCases.description: Verify passCode and storage are private
